explanations.machine learning: The paper proposes a novel method for corporate credit risk prediction using machine learning techniques.
explanations.supervised learning: The model undergoes supervised fine-tuning as part of its two-stage training process.
explanations.unsupervised learning: The model includes unsupervised pretraining as the first stage of its training process.
explanations.classification: The paper focuses on predicting corporate credit risk, which is a classification problem.
explanations.feature learning: The model aims to effectively extract features from each modality of the data.
explanations.feature representation: The study involves joint representation learning from multimodal data.
explanations.neural network: The proposed method is based on an extended deep belief network, which is a type of neural network.
explanations.deep learning: The paper utilizes advanced deep learning techniques such as ResNet and BERT.
explanations.representation learning: The model learns joint representations from multimodal data to enhance performance.
explanations.deep belief network: The proposed method is an extension of the deep belief network (DBN).
explanations.unsupervised pre-train: The model includes an unsupervised pretraining stage before supervised fine-tuning.
